oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pathogenesis of Diarrhea in Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wagner, Sarah
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Calf diarrhea
viral pathogens
bacterial pathogens
protozoal pathogens
tissue damage
hypoglycemia
hypothermia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Calf diarrhea (scours) remains an important cause of illness and death in both dairy and beef herds. There are several viral, bacterial and protozoal pathogens that cause diarrhea in calves; many clinical cases of diarrhea result from infection by more than one pathogen. Infection with diarrhea- causing pathogens causes tissue damage and malfunction, which may lead to dehydration, electrolyte imbalances, acidosis, hypoglycemia, hypothermia, and other problems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2006; 219-220
